channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: It's the deadliest year for ICE in decades. As detentions rise, the trend may continue
item.description: There have been at least 20 deaths in ICE custody in 2025, the deadliest year since 2004. As the agency is ramping up hiring and increasing detentions...

item.title: NBA coach Chauncey Billups, player Terry Rozier arrested in FBI gambling probe
item.description: Rozier, a guard for the Miami Heat, was investigated by the NBA in 2023 in connection with suspicious gambling activity on a game that he exited early...

item.title: Vance slams Israel's parliament vote on West Bank annexation, calling it an 'insult'

item.title: Court to rule on troop deployment. And, a new Pentagon press corps emerges
item.description: A court could rule on legal challenges surrounding the National Guard deployments in the coming days. And, a new policy for Pentagon reporters has led...

item.title: Anglican Church Archbishop accused of sexual misconduct

item.title: Health care compromise appears far off as the government shutdown stalemate persists
US kills three in second strike on alleged drug boats in the Pacific
item.description: This is the ninth US strike on alleged drug boats near Latin America, and the second in the Pacific.

item.title: A history of government shutdowns: 14 other times funding has lapsed since 1980
item.description: The federal government was unable to avert a lapse in funding. Here's a look at the 14 other shutdowns that have occurred since 1980.

item.title: How could a government shutdown affect Social Security recipients?
item.description: The U.S. government shut down on Wednesday after Congress failed to approve funding for federal agencies. Here's how that could affect Social Security...

item.title: Rubio warns against West Bank annexation after Israel's parliament advances move
item.description: The US Secretary of State says such a step would threaten Washington's plan to end the conflict in Gaza.

item.title: As heat gets more extreme, pregnant farmworkers are increasingly at risk

item.title: New images show Israeli control line deeper into Gaza than expected
item.description: Israel has placed boundary markers up to 520m deeper inside Gaza than expected under the ceasefire deal with Hamas.

item.title: How will the government shutdown impact the U.S. military?

item.title: How will the government shutdown affect people applying for mortgages?
item.description: Some people taking out a home loan and purchasing flood insurance could face delays during the U.S. government shutdown.

item.title: Trump says 'existing structure' of White House East Wing to be torn down
item.description: The US president previously said that his $250m (£186m) ballroom addition would not "interfere with the current building".
